Data: Maxwell to Gambhir, 2 runs half-volley, driven nicely past cover, the batsmen think they have got four runs, but the ball slows up, and they jog through for two. Pathan wasn't even running to begin with. Will India regret this missed run in a last-ball finish?
Maxwell to Gambhir, no run short of a length, cut away, but can't beat point
Maxwell to Gambhir, no run this one is darted in, hits the inside edge on the way to the pad
Maxwell to Gambhir, FOUR runs too full and high again, and he has square-driven this between cover and cover-point. There's no stopping this one, though
Maxwell to Gambhir, 1 run full, on the pads, worked away to deep midwicket
Maxwell to Pathan, 1 leg bye full, on the pads, turns a little, beats a half-sweep, concedes a leg-bye
Starc to Pathan, 1 run length ball, angling in, pushed into the leg side for one
Starc to Gambhir, 1 run length ball again, on the pads, worked away
Starc to Pathan, no run length ball, angling in towards top of off, punched to mid-off
Starc to Pathan, 1 leg bye short, skiddy, beats him for pace on the pull, but Pathan gets a leg-bye
Starc to Gambhir, FOUR runs short, wide enough, and he has steered this past point. Just guided past the man. Lovely timing
Starc to Gambhir, no run another short and wide delivery, but this time it bounces a little extra and he finds the man at point
Cummins to Pathan, 1 run length ball, outside off, push-driven wide of mid-off
Cummins to Gambhir, FOUR runs and he angles it in too far with the fine leg up in the circle. Deftly glanced away by Gambhir. Minimum effort, four runs for the taking
Cummins to Gambhir, no run more accurate now, on a length, middle and off, defended
Cummins to Gambhir, no run short of a length, punched away nicely, but can't beat point
Cummins to Gambhir, 1 run dug it in, Gambhir backed away to steer it past point from outside leg

Cummins to Pathan, OUT great footwork from Cummins. Short of a length, gets a little big on him, he drops it just off the pitch and runs. On most occasions these result in singles, but Cummins has other ideas here. he strides towards the ball, and kicks it towards the stump, dislodging the bails a second before Gambhir's bat has slid in.
Starc to Pathan, 1 run pitched up, middle and leg, flicked away to deep square leg
Starc to Kohli, FOUR runs and he really can't do anything wrong. A decent delivery, short of a length, outside off, and he has punched it to the right of third man for four
Starc to Kohli, 1 run short of a length, on the pads, worked away for one
Starc to Pathan, 1 run pulled away off the front foot, gets a single to deep square leg
Starc to Kohli, no run pulled away, wide of mid-on, but Hogg makes a diving save. Australia on with their fielding game
Starc to Kohli, 1 run full, on the pads, flicked away, Hogg makes another diving save, but can't prevent the single
Watson to Kohli, 1 run short of a length, middle and leg, worked away for one
Watson to Pathan, SIX runs allrounder to allrounder, Watson will not be pleased. Length ball, outside off, and Pathan has lofted him right over his head. An evidence of the batting talent
Watson to Pathan, no run drops this into the leg side, finds short midwicket
Watson to Pathan, 1 run full, on the pads, flicked away for a single
Watson to Kohli, 1 run short of a length, into the pads, worked away for an easy single
Watson to Pathan, FOUR runs top shot from Pathan again. Jumps out of the crease, makes room too, takes a length ball from off and lofts it over point. That's a difficult shot to play
Christian to Kohli, 1 run dabbed away to third man for one
Christian to Pathan, 1 run dragged from outside off, gets a single to mid-on
Christian to Kohli, 1 run push-driven wide of mid-off for one
Christian to Pathan, 1 run Pathan gives him the charge, he bowls the slower ball, Pathan guides it fine on the leg side, Watson makes a diving save at short fine leg
Christian to Kohli, FOUR runs Kohli on the charge now, gets a wide length ball, drives it inside-out, past the desperate diving hand at extra cover
Christian to Kohli, no run late-cuts this short ball, but can't get it past point
Hogg to Pathan, FOUR runs stars off with a big wide down the leg side, but Pathan sees an easy four for himself and guides this between the keeper and short fine leg
Hogg to Pathan, 1 run gets the length and line better, on a length, middle and leg, turning away, worked into the leg side for one
Hogg to Kohli, 1 run bowls a long hop, and has been pulled to deep midwicket
Hogg to Pathan, no run huge shout for lbw short delivery, skids on, pitches leg, but doesn't straighten enough

Hogg to Pathan, no run another shout, this one doesn't turn, though, and is sliding down leg. Pathan is playing for the turn, but is not quite getting it here, and has twice come close to being given out lbw
Hogg to Pathan, no run tossed up, this turns after pitching outside leg, beating his sweep. He won't even get a leg-bye here
Cummins to Kohli, no run that's good pace. Short of a length, 142ks, getting to to bounce towards the chest, hits the top of the bat

Cummins to Kohli, OUT pace has done him in. This is one of the rare instances in recent times that Kohli has been done in comprehensively by a bowler. It's the pace and bounce again. Short, close to 143ks, his weight didn't go back as he pulled, and ended up skying it towards mid-off. Christian had to run to to his right, and put a slide
Cummins to Pathan, 2 runs full, on off, goes off the outer half of the bat, a misfield from Warner at point costs them two runs

Cummins to Pathan, 1 run it's the bouncer again, but Pathan's mis-hit doesn't carry to deep midwicket. Top effort from Starc, though. A bit too quick for Pathan, but it never looks like carrying. Starc charges in, though, puts a full-length dive in, but reaches it on the half-volley
Cummins to Yuvraj, no run bouncer again, healthy pace too, good over so far. Yuvraj sways out of the line here
Cummins to Yuvraj, 1 run tucked away off the hip for a single

Hogg to Raina, FOUR runs misfielded. That's a little embarrassing by Aussie standards. Driven back at him, and through Hogg's legs. Straight through them. Warner puts in a desperate dive at long-off, but can't keep it in
Hogg to Raina, 1 run Raina reads this googly off the pitch, guides it into the leg side for one
Hogg to Dhoni, no run Dhoni plays a the cut, in front of square, can't beat extra cover
Hogg to Dhoni, 5 wide that's a bad delivery. Length ball, on leg, turning sharply in, for five wides
Hogg to Dhoni, no run no clue about that googly. Pitched on leg again, he plays for the turn, and is beaten comprehensively by the away turn
Hogg to Dhoni, no run no clue about the googly again, and even though is short, all he manages is an edge to point
Hogg to Dhoni, no run and he ends it with another unread googly, which squares Dhoni up in defence. Good comeback from those five wides
Cummins to Raina, 1 run short of a length, steered away to third man for one
Cummins to Dhoni, no run length ball, headed towards top of off, pushed to cover
Cummins to Dhoni, 2 runs slower bouncer, Dhoni waits and waits, and pulls it well for two. Well doe to Hogg, too, who charges to his right from fine leg, puts in a dive, keeps the ball in play
Cummins to Dhoni, no run cramped up for room, punched straight to straight extra cover
Cummins to Dhoni, no run another dot. Short of a length, quick, on off, no room, pushed back to him

Cummins to Dhoni, OUT pressure of dot balls there. This is a wide half-volley, might even have been called wide had he not driven at it. No feet means he is reaching out, and manages just a limp hit straight to extra cover
Hogg to Yuvraj, no run googly, too short, though, punched away, but in the air, and it falls just short of short extra cover
Hogg to Yuvraj, no run full now, driven to short extra cover again

Hogg to Yuvraj, FOUR runs looked like a googly, but it didn't even land. The leg-side full toss has been smashed wide of long-on where Christian tried to do too much with it. He dived and also tried to lob it up for a relay throw, but failed to collect it first
Hogg to Yuvraj, no run accurate length ball, no turn, defended back to him
Hogg to Yuvraj, 1 run short of a length, quicker delivery, goes deep into the crease to get a single to long-on
Hogg to Pathan, 1 run flighted generously, almost a yorker, dug out for a single to the right of short extra cover
Maxwell to Pathan, 1 run driven to long-on for one
Maxwell to Yuvraj, 1 run worked away off the pads
Maxwell to Pathan, no run looks for a vertical-bat pull, is beaten by the pace off the pitch
Maxwell to Pathan, 1 run Pathan charges at him, mis-hits, which is just as well because it doesn't carry to long-on
Maxwell to Yuvraj, 1 run driven to long-on for a single
Maxwell to Pathan, no run appeal for lbw as this short ball skids and stays low, but it is also headed down leg side
Christian to Raina, FOUR runs poor delivery at death. Length ball, 127ks, on leg, Raina punches it back over his head. Lands inches inside the boundary cushion. High elbow held for cameras
Christian to Raina, 1 run short and wide now, cut away to deep point
Christian to Ashwin, no run wide length all, he slashes at it and missed. Lucky to get away with it
Christian to Ashwin, FOUR runs Christian got away with it last ball, but you can't afford bowling wide length balls at death. Ashwin opens the face, drives it square, between cover-point and point
Christian to Ashwin, 1 run wide half-volley, driven to long-off
Christian to Raina, 1 run full, on off, driven to long-off for one
Starc to Raina, no run bloody good yorker. Is Wasim Akram watching and approving of it? Swinging in, on off, dug out, but back to Starc
Starc to Raina, 1 run short and wide, gets away with it. Toe-ended to to the left of sweeper-cover, but with Ashwin there is no danger of conceding the second
Starc to Ashwin, SIX runs never mind the seconds, take this six from Ashwin. He ,may not run, he can hit the ball. Bouncer, at 140ks, and he has pulled this well over midwicket
Starc to Ashwin, no run gives him the charge, misses as he drives at a short-of-a-length delivery
Starc to Ashwin, 2 runs Hogg could have caught this. Helped away off the hip, in the air, towards fine leg, Hogg gets around it, but doesn't run in at all. It lands on a half-volley for him
Starc to Ashwin, no run another charge, swing and miss. This one held its line just outside off
Watson to Yuvraj, OUT Bouncer is back. Hello. And so is Watson's golden arm. Digs this in, Yuvraj likes the drop in pace from Cummins, and he top-edges it to deep midwicket
Watson to Pathan, 2 runs another mis-hit from Pathan, and it is safe again. Short from Watson, looks to pull it, gets a bottom edge past the keeper
Watson to Pathan, no run length ball, on the pads, worked away, but not through the infield
Watson to Pathan, 1 run pulled away to deep square leg for one
Watson to Rohit Sharma, 1 run length ball, on off, plays with an open face, gets a single between cover and point

Watson to Pathan, OUT Watson strikes again. India might even be thankful that Pathan is out. Memories of Ravindra Jadeja's promotion all those years ago when he tried his best to hit out but just couldn't. This is full, on the pads, flicked away, straight to short midwicket

Starc to Rohit Sharma, OUT played all around it. Wide of the crease, slightly low arm, angled in towards top of off, Sharma just misses the line completely, the bat coming down from slips, but looking to play straight. The off stump goes for a walk. Australia on a hat-trick
Starc to Dhoni, no run length ball outside off, left alone
Starc to Dhoni, 1 run driven away on the up, and the sweeper-cover does really well with the bad bounce on this patchy outfield
Starc to Raina, no run length ball, on off, pushed to short cover
Starc to Raina, 1 run short, outside off, steered away, and third man keeps them down to one with a dive

Starc to Dhoni, 2 runs Watson is everywhere. Wide length ball, Dhoni throws his hands at it, gets a thick edge past slip, third man is wide, but Watson does really well with a desperate dive to save two runs
Cummins to Raina, 1 run slower bouncer, Raina pulls it, top edge lands safe
Cummins to Ashwin, no run walks right across the stumps and misses a plum full toss. Ashwin wants a no-ball for height, but the umpire doesn't oblige
Cummins to Ashwin, 1 run slower ball, slogged away, along the ground, gets a single

Cummins to Raina, 2 byes slower short ball, Raina connects thin air with his wild heave, they take a bye, Wade lobs the throw too far, and then Hogg fails to back up well at mid-off, allowing them a second
Cummins to Raina, 1 run slower bouncer again, pulled away to deep midwicket
Cummins to Ashwin, no run wide and full, Ashwin charges down, and misses by about a foot. No bye this time
Watson to Raina, FOUR runs slower ball gone wrong, and he has smacked this full toss into the cow corner. Warner puts a dive in, but cant touch it
Watson to Raina, FOUR runs poor bowling. Fine leg is up, and he is full and on the pads. Raina takes the gifted runs

Watson to Raina, OUT Raina falls in search for quick runs. Wide length ball, he gets under it, but can't clear long-off. Watson hasn't bowled the best of overs, but with this wicket he has a chance to pull it all back. Decent hand from Raina, though
Watson to Ashwin, 1 run looks to walks across, Watson bowls a wide full delivery, Ashwin gets a thick edge to third man
Watson to Harbhajan, 1 run full toss, absolutely smashed, but for a single to long-on
Watson to Ashwin, 1 run shuffles across again, Watson has enough time to realise that and bowls full and wide, and Ashwin gets just the single to cover

9.02pm Australia will be pleased with their effort here, but India are not entirely out of it either. They know if they can get a couple of wickets early, their spinners can control the game. An interesting second half is set up. See you in 10 minutes
Ashwin to bowl the first over. Watson on strike. One slip in place
Ashwin to Watson, no run goes a bit away after pitching short of length, pushed to the off side
Ashwin to Watson, 1 run length ball on middle and leg, tapped towards mid-on for a single
Ashwin to Warner, FOUR runs fullish and outside off, spinning away and that is carved through cover for four
Ashwin to Warner, FOUR runs flighted half-volley, tossed up generously, and Warner throws the bath tub at it, slogging it between the umpire and mid-on
Ashwin to Warner, no run the one that come in, Warner reads it off the pitch, but keeps it out
Ashwin to Warner, no run another slider, Warner gets an inside edge onto the pad, but all is safe
Khan to Watson, 2 runs Sharma scored one run and has conceded two already. Pushed to cover, where Sharma doesn't go down, doesn't get behind the ball, and lets it through
Khan to Watson, 1 wide big wide outside off, Watson tries to hit it, but can't
Khan to Watson, no run length ball, on off, pushed back to him
Khan to Watson, no run shaping in slightly, driven on the up, but straight to mid-off
Khan to Watson, no run short of a length, just outside off, angling away, beats his dab
Khan to Watson, 1 run length ball, on off, driven on the up, just to the left of Chawla, and they steal a single. Not many fielders would allow that
Khan to Warner, no run short of a length, gets the width, goes hard at it, gets a bottom edge into the pitch
Ashwin to Watson, 1 run offbreak, middle and off, flicked away past midwicket for one
Ashwin to Warner, no run pauses and delivers, turns it into the pads, pushed to square leg
Ashwin to Warner, no run another pause before delivering, Warner backs away to punch a flat delivery, but straight to cover
Ashwin to Warner, no run angling in again, inside edge onto the pad
Ashwin to Warner, 3 runs incredible shot. Makes room to this delivery angling, takes it from well outside leg, and punches it between two cover fieldsmen. Chawla's chase allows an easy three
Ashwin to Watson, no run sweeps, sweeps fine, but straight to short fine
Khan to Warner, FOUR runs another incredible shot. All hands and wrists. Short of a lenght, no room, and he has punched it away past point. All the power coming in through the wrists
Khan to Warner, no run length ball, on off, shaping away a little, draws respect from Warner
Khan to Warner, no run walks down to Zaheer Khan who digs it in at 131ks and hits him in the ribs. No show of pain
Khan to Warner, 1 run short of a length, 135ks, kicks at him, takes the shoulder of the bat, but it's wide enough of point
Khan to Watson, no run short of a length, defended
Khan to Watson, no run big lbw shout, but this is not swinging at all and is pitched at least a foot outside the line of leg
Ashwin to Warner, 1 wide paused and delivers a flat wide down the leg side
Ashwin to Warner, 1 run makes room and pulls a dart to deep midwicket
Ashwin to Watson, no run the carrom ball, length ball, on leg, straightens, punched to straight midwicket

Ashwin to Watson, SIX runs long hop outside leg, and there is no hope if you bowl that to Watson. He has pulled it over square leg. Doesn't matter if it is a carrom ball or a chess ball if you bowl that short
Ashwin to Watson, no run presses forward, goes deep into the crease to pull this, but finds midwicket
Ashwin to Watson, 2 runs carrom ball outside off, late-cut past slip, gets a couple
Ashwin to Watson, SIX runs this is a bit of rubbish from Ashwin. Another long hop, into the pads, and Watson has deposited it over midwicket
Khan to Warner, FOUR runs short, wide, gentle pace, and he has punched it between cover and cover-point. An over too many for Zaheer?

Khan to Warner, no run huge shout, and he looked dead. Length ball, just outside off, skidding on, hits him in front of middle and leg. That was close, but Umpire Kettleborough thought it was headed down, but replays show he was dead. Kohli is not happy, and lets it be known through a popular Indian expletive
Khan to Warner, no run length ball on off, defended back to him
Khan to Warner, FOUR runs length ball, outside off, and he has driven this with an open face, and over point. India running away with it
Khan to Warner, 1 run fuller, middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
Khan to Watson, no run another huge lbw shout, but without any swing this has to have pitched well outside leg. Zaheer doesn't find it amusing, though
Harbhajan to Warner, 1 run length ball, outside ff, punched away to sweeper-cover
Harbhajan to Watson, no run flighted outside off, pretty slow through the air, defended well
Harbhajan to Watson, 1 run drags this short, Watson ricks back and pulls this to deep midwicket along the ground
Harbhajan to Warner, FOUR runs short again, 87ks, Warner rocks back too, and pulls this smack between long-on and deep midwicket
Harbhajan to Warner, no run flighted this time, on off, defended with an open face
Harbhajan to Warner, no run this one doesn't turn after pitching off, hits the inside half of the bat
Chawla to Watson, SIX runs welcome to the crease. You may as well give the red rag to a bull. Long hop, middle and leg, to Watson. Need I mention what happened after that?
Chawla to Watson, 1 run not-turning legbreak, cut away to deep point
Chawla to Warner, no run non-turner again, pitched on leg, defended off the back foot
Chawla to Warner, 1 run slides with the angle again, cut away to deep cover
Chawla to Watson, no run slider, well bowled, accurate, Watson stays back to defend
Chawla to Watson, SIX runs wide half-volley, Watson is not going to respect them. Slog-sweeps it dead straight for a flat six
Harbhajan to Warner, no run flighted, 85ks, pitches outside leg, beats his drive
Harbhajan to Warner, SIX runs that's a bull-headed shot. Flighted outside off, played against the turn, mis-hit slightly, but he has enough power and bat behind it to clear deep midwicket
Harbhajan to Warner, SIX runs if mis-hits are flying for sixes, imagine when he hits them clean. It goes deep towards the end of the stadium. This is carnage
Harbhajan to Warner, 1 run Harbhajan's most threatening delivery. The tppie that slides into the left-hand batsman. He got Morgan that way, but Warner gets his bat down in time
Harbhajan to Watson, 1 run only slightly short, but Watson rocks back to pull this away
Harbhajan to Warner, no run short of a length, on off, gets a bottom edge on the cut
Pathan to Watson, no run length ball, on middle and leg, angling towards off, defended back to him

Pathan to Watson, SIX runs that's into the third tier. Irfan is not even quarter the bowler with the old ball. why would you not give him the new swinging ball? This is short and a sitting duck. Don't bowl this to Watson
Pathan to Watson, FOUR runs oh he has angled this well down leg with fine leg up. It's gone past that man for his fifty
Pathan to Watson, 2 runs late-cuts this for a couple, fine of third man
Pathan to Watson, 1 run late-cuts again, and keeps strike
Kohli to Watson, no run full, on off, inside edge into the pad
Kohli to Watson, no run slow, legbreak, defended again
Kohli to Watson, 2 runs full toss, on the pads, driven to long-on
Kohli to Watson, no run slow through the air again, defended solidly
Kohli to Watson, SIX runs beautiful shot. Nothing brutal about it. Full, middle and leg, and he has lofted this dead straight. Just a caress
Kohli to Watson, 2 runs short of a length, hurrying onto him, pushed towards long-on, and they steal the second
Yuvraj to Warner, no run slow, very slow, and has he dropped it? Yes he has. Warner went to cut it hard, edged it, but it didn't stick in. Dhoni is not getting anything right here
Yuvraj to Warner, no run
Yuvraj to Warner, no run tries the slog-sweep, but is beaten
Yuvraj to Warner, no run flighted outside off, pushed to extra cover
Yuvraj to Warner, 1 run flat outside off, punched to deep cover
Yuvraj to Watson, 1 run full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for a quiet little single
Rohit Sharma to Watson, 2 runs short of a length, pulled away, gets a couple wide of long-on
Rohit Sharma to Watson, 1 run slog-sweeps this flat, and well short of deep midwicket
Rohit Sharma to Warner, 3 runs three more runs gifted by Chawla. Short of a length, on off, punched to extra cover, and it hits Chawla's hand and ricochets to wide of long-off
Rohit Sharma to Watson, 1 run Watson has missed out on a six. Full toss, on the pads, mis-hits the slog-sweep, gets just a single
Rohit Sharma to Warner, 1 run fifty for Warner too, with a punch down to long-off. He has heard a bit from Indian fielders, and is pretty satisfied with his effort. No Indian fielder near him now
Rohit Sharma to Watson, FOUR runs full, on the pads, smacked away with a flick of the wrists, and it keeps travelling, beating deep midwicket
Yuvraj to Warner, SIX runs It might well be. He starts with a buffet full toss, and Warner has cleared deep midwicket with ease
Yuvraj to Warner, 3 runs that's insult to injury. Yuvraj gets another edge, past keeper, through vacant slip region
Yuvraj to Maxwell, 1 run flighted, full toss, driven to long-on
Yuvraj to Warner, FOUR runs wide half-volley, slog-swept over midwicket. One shot away now
Yuvraj to Warner, no run India will at least bowl another over. Yuvraj ensures it with a quicker flatter delivery, which Warner punches straight to extra cover
Ashwin to Maxwell, no run Ashwin finally gets an edge with a carrom ball, but it falls short of slip
Ashwin to Maxwell, no run offbreak now, off and middle, defended back
Ashwin to Maxwell, 2 runs carrom ball, wide outside off, punched to sweeper-cover
Ashwin to Maxwell, no run slower now, flighted on off, defended to leg
Ashwin to Maxwell, 1 run fitting end to the match. Zaheer at cover dives on this like London Bridge falling down, and lets it through for four
Australia enjoying it thoroughly. They have mauled India on a slow track after losing the toss. And before the start of the match, Australia were ranked No. 9 to India's No. 3
Australia won by 9 wickets (with 31 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Shane Watson, AUS
